meanings.definition: A person who walks with a limp.
meanings.sent1: The limpers in the race struggled to keep up with the others.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of limpers at the park, each with a unique way of walking.
meanings.sent3: The limpers at the party had a dance-off, showcasing their unique moves.
meanings.sent4: The limpers in the marathon were like determined warriors battling through the pain.
meanings.sent5: The limpers in the crowd stood out with their distinctive gait.

meanings.definition: A plural noun referring to individuals who walk with a limp.
meanings.sent1: We noticed a group of limpers crossing the street together.
meanings.sent2: The limpers gathered at the support group to share their experiences.
meanings.sent3: The limpers at the zoo hobbled around, amusing the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: The limpers on the hiking trail moved slowly but steadily, like a determined team.
meanings.sent5: The limpers in the movie added a touch of realism to the scene.
